contracts.title: Padiham Town Hall - Repairs and Refurbishment
contracts.description:
General building and repair works Padiham Town Hall, Padiham, Burnley. The works involve stripping out flood damaged materials and carrying out repairs and refurbishment of the basement and part of the ground floor of the building. Padiham Town Hall is a listed building and suppliers must be able to reference repairs and refurbishment projects on similar listed or historic buildings.

There will be two contractor access days on 31st August and 1st September to view the site. Please contact Bru

contracts.title: Dog Kennelling Services, Burnley
contracts.description:
Tenders are invited from contractors having the resources, sufficient capacity and experience working with Local Authority clients to provide Dog Kennelling Services for stray dogs in the Borough of Burnley. The provision of Kennelling Services will be split into three lots.

contracts.title: Long Term Plan for the Town (Burnley): Consultancy Services
contracts.description: Burnley Borough Council is looking to commission consultancy services, on behalf of the Burnley Town Board, to develop a Long Term Plan for the Town (LTPT) including a 10-year vision and 3-year investment plan in accordance with LTPT guidance. See the Consultancy Brief published and ITT document on www.the-chest.org.uk ref. DN710672 for further information.

contracts.title: Burnley Cemetery Extension
contracts.description:
Burnley Borough Council wishes to appoint a suitably qualified consultant with experience in the design and development of Cemeteries to act as the lead consultant to develop a scheme to extend Burnley Cemetery.  

The consultant should have an in-depth knowledge of the regulations relating to cemeteries and the detailed landscape design of cemetery projects, burial practices and leading a team of sub-consultants to deliver cemetery projects.
contracts.cpv_description: Architectural services for outdoor areas and Landscape architectural services and Cemetery services

The role of the Consultant is to manage all aspects of the development/design and delivery of the scheme in partnership with the Council, whilst ensuring value for money and that high standards of building repair and conservation are achieved.
contracts.cpv_description: Advisory architectural services and Architectural design services and Architectural, engineering and surveying services

contracts.description:
Burnley Borough Council has, as part of a partnership with East Lancashire Community Safety Partnership, been successful in a bid to the  Home Office's Safer Streets Fund.  The Funding's purpose is to deliver schemes with the aim of reducing acqucisitive crime in areas with high crime rates. This can be through physical interventions  or community engagement.

contracts.title: Padiham Town Hall External Repairs & Internal Refurbishment
contracts.description: Tenders are invited from organisations that have the resources and ability to carry out external repairs and internal refurbishment to Padiham Town Hall , Burnley Road Padiham, BB12 8BS. The building will be available for inspection on 2 full days from 10.00 - 16.00 hrs : Monday 2nd March 2020 and Thursday 5th March 2020. Additional viewings will be undertaken by appointment only. See ITT and Schedule of works on  The Chest. Tender submission must be via The Chest.

contracts.title: Supply of Wheeled Bins
contracts.description: This opportunity was only open to those suppliers registered on the Yorkshire Purchasing Organisation Framework 551 'Supply of Wheeled Bins' who are able to supply and deliver wheeled bins to a central location in Burnley. Suppliers were also required to provide a separate quotation for the delivery of wheeled bins from a central location in Burnley to the curtilage of properties in the borough. contracts.title: Parker Lane Civic Offices Customer Services Fit Out
contracts.description: Tenders are invited from organisations that have the resources and ability to carry out the fit out of a Customer Services Centre at Civic Offices, Parker Lane, Burnley to meet the required contract specification as set out in the ITT documents.

contracts.title: Dog Kennelling Services
contracts.description: To appoint a contractor(s) to provide Dog Services for Stray Dogs in the Borough of Burnley including the provision of Kennelling Services.

contracts.title: Remedial Roof Works Burnley Market
contracts.description: Former Open Market deck waterproofing. The works comprise the provision and installation of a Kemperol V 210 waterproofing membrane  to the former open-market, asphalt floor deck, in accordance with the specification provided under separate cover. The works must be undertaken by a Kemper 'Approved Contractor'. The whole of the works (materials and construction) should be warranted for a minimum period of 20 years from the Completion Date provided by the Project Manager.
contracts.cpv_description: Roof-covering work and Waterproofing work and Construction-related services

contracts.title: Consultants for Development of Business Improvement District: Burnley
contracts.description: Burnley Council is seeking to appoint an appropriately qualified and experienced consultant to work with them to develop a Business Improvement District (BID) for Burnley town centre, taking on board the findings of the feasibility study and leading on delivering the BID development process from planning and development to campaign, ballot and post-ballot stages.

contracts.title: Re-Roofing and Repair Works at Burnley Town Hall
contracts.description: Tenders are invited from organisation that have the resources and ability to carry out the re-roofing and repair works to Burnley Town Hall (Listed building).  The works inolves re-roofing the Town Hall including the repair and/or replacement of associated rainwater goods. Works will also include repairs to clock tower roof, localised repointing and redecoration of existing windows. See tender documents for specification/ schedule of works on www.the-chest.org.uk

contracts.title: Environmental Enforcement Services
contracts.description:
Tenders are invited from organisation that have the resources and ability to demonstrate sufficient capacity and skills to address the Council's key strategic priorities in tackling and deterring littering and dog fouling (control) as detailed in the Specification of this tender

contracts.title: Curzon Street Town Centre Development, Burnley
contracts.description: The Councils requirement is for a leisure-led mixed use redevelopment of the town centre site. contracts.title: Communicating Burnley - Public Relations Services
contracts.description:
This opportunity is to invite public relations companies and agencies to submit their proposals for a PR and communications delivery plan commencing May 2018 with the potential to extend based on performance. The goal of the campaign is to position Burnley as youthful, cultural and intelligent in order to attract and retain people in their teens, twenties and thirties.

contracts.title: Facilities Management Contract Burnley Bus Station
contracts.description: The Contract requirements are for the general management of Burnley Bus Station on behalf of the Council. The successful contractor shall ensure that the premises and adjoining land are kept in a clean, functional and safe condition for the duration of the Contract. The successful contractor shall be responsible for the security of the premises and the management of bus operators. contracts.title: Demolition of Open Market, former Cinema and Access Bridges - Bankfield, Burnley, Lancashire
contracts.description: The project is for taking down and making good a former cinema block, open-market area, vehicular access bridge and a pedestrian access bridge, all constructed circa 1967. The principal, structural, building elements being in-situ, reinforced concrete beams, columns, floor slabs and roof slabs. Asbestos surveys, condition surveys and utility surveys have been carried-out. These will be made available for tendering companies together with the appropriate technical drawings. contracts.title: Committee Management System ITT
contracts.description:
The administration and control of the Council’s democratic framework and decision making process is currently reliant upon manual processes. The Council recognises the need to modernise existing arrangements to enable more effective and efficient ways of working that will also bring further transparency to a more accessible Council decision making process.

contracts.description: Tenders are invited from organisations that have the resources and ability to undertake the professional services outlined within the Tender Brief. The Council is seeking a suitably qualified consultancy or consortium of consultancies to develop a comprehensive, ambitious and deliverable masterplan for Burnley Town Centre and the adjoining Weavers Triangle area. The aim is to establish a lean, tax efficient JV structure focused upon pro-actively managing the delivery of the Council's housing development scheme.
